info.title: Wink Payment API
info.description:
A programmatic way to create bookings, receive payment and disburse funds globally.

## APIs
Not every integrator needs every APIs. For that reason, we have separated APIs into context.

- [Affiliate](/affiliate): All APIs related to selling travel inventory as an affiliate.
- [Analytics](/analytics): All APIs related to tracking metrics across a wide variety of data source segments including, more entertaining, leaderboard metrics.
- [Booking](/booking): All APIs related to creating platform bookings.
- [Channel Manager](/channel-manager): All APIs related to channel managers who want to integrate with our platform.
- [Extranet](/extranet): All APIs related to managing travel inventory and suppliers.
- [Inventory](/inventory): All APIs related to retrieve known travel inventory as it was found using the Lookup API..
- [Lookup](/lookup): All APIs related to locating inventory by region, locale and property flags.
- [Reference](/reference): All APIs related to retrieving platform-supported taxonomies.
- [TripPay](/payment): All APIs related to TripPay account management, booking, mapping and integration features.

## SDKs
We are actively working on supporting the most used languages out there. If you don't see your language here, reach out to us with a request to officially add your language. In the meantime, if you want to roll your own SDK, you can do so by downloading the OpenAPI spec and using one of the many available OpenAPI generators available: [https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/generators](https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/generators).

- Java SDK [https://github.com/wink-travel/trip-pay-sdk-java](https://github.com/wink-travel/trip-pay-sdk-java)

# Usage
These features are made available to you via a [REST API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer). This API is language agnostic. We will link to SDKs for the most popular programming languages on this page as they become available.

## Versioning
We chose to version our endpoints in a way that we hope affects your integration with us the least. You request the version of our API you wish to work with via the `Wink-Version` header. When it's time for you to upgrade, you only have to change the version number to get access to our updated endpoints.

## Release history
- 2022-10-15: v2.0 - Removed HATEOAS and added Wink-Version header
- 2021-12-01: v1 - Initial release

tags.name: Account Mappings
tags.description: Use the Account Mapping API to manage a single account's mapping with TripPay accounts.

tags.name: Mapping
tags.description: Use the Mapping API to search for, create and map your properties against TripPay properties.

tags.name: Agent
tags.description: Create a booking as an agent.

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Use the Account API to manage accounts on TripPay.

tags.name: Webhook
tags.description: Use the Webhook API to create webhooks to interface with the TripPay API.

tags.name: Acquiring
tags.description: Use the Acquiring API to help facilitate our payment flows.

tags.name: Managing entity
tags.description: Managed entities can be bound to applications and webhooks.

tags.name: Application
tags.description: Use the Application API to create applications to interface with the TripPay API.

patch.description: Requests a refund for a booking contract. Creates a refund request record that needs to be approved by a payment admin.

In the event that a booking is not possible on the partner site due to lack of availability, or similar. This endpoint offers a 3-minute window to let that partner refund the traveler 100% of her funds.

requestBody.description: Accompanying payload that described the optional reason for using this endpoint.

patch.description: Cancels a booking contract. Based on the type of cancellation policy, will do a refund or partial refund to the payment method.

In the event that a booking is not possible on the partner site due to lack of availability, or similar. This endpoint offers a 3-minute window to let that partner refund the traveler 100% of her funds.

requestBody.description: Accompanying payload that described the optional reason for using this endpoint.

patch.description: Cancels a group booking contract. All bookings under the same traceId.

swiftCode.description: Bank SWIFT code. Unique code identifier the bank and branch of the bank account.

routingNumber.description: Bank account routing number. This is sort code in HK and Zengin code in JP.

accountNumber.description: Bank account number. In all EU countries, this would be the IBAN. In other countries, the routing number will apply as well.

primary.description: One bank account always needs to be primary.

createdDate.description: Datetime this record was first created

lastUpdate.description: Datetime this record was last updated

version.description: Version property that shows how many times this document has been persisted. Document will not persist if the version property is less than current version property in the system. Result in an optimistic locking exception.

type.description: Type of account tells us what the account is capable of.

ownerType.description: Type of account owner tells us whether ths account is managed by a company or an individual.

accountOwnerIdentifier.description: The entity that created this account.

name.description: Name of company / full name of person

legalName.description: Legal name of entity if other than name

userIdentifier.description: The authenticated user that owns this account.

accountEmail.description: Account email is where we will send KYC documents and other account specific mailings

description.example: My Company is the best company ever.

url.description: Company website. If private person with no personal website, link to main social network account.

status.description: Account status shows if it's approved

ownerTypeIdentifier.description: This is the tax identification number (TIN) for individuals and entity identification number (EIN) for companies.

dob.description: This is the individual's date of birth.

preferredDisbursementType.description: The preferred method which the account holder wishes to be paid. This will play a role if we choose to automate the payout flow.

Account.description: Account holds KYC, bank account and contact information of an affiliate, supplier, payment or any type of entity that is to be a beneficiary of funds through the payment.

priority.description: Determines how vendors are displayed in a list

Acquirer.description: Payment method with the details describing how to make a payment happen

key1.description: A key that can be used as a token

key2.description: Can be used alongside key1 as credentials

AcquirerCredentials.description: How we interact with the acquirer

primary.description: One bank account always needs to be primary.

BankAccount.description: Accounts use bank accounts to get paid.

items.description: An alternate name for the city

GeoName.description: GeoNames have been created at [https://geonames.org](https://geonames.org) and contain geographical destinations we use as geoname data to associate travel inventory with a location.

SubCountry.description: Country subdivision such as a state or province

Mapping.description: Mapping record is responsible for mapping a local account identifier with a remote system. When a booking comes in from the remote system, we will know how to properly assign funds to the correct accounts.

BeneficiaryCharge.description: A variable charge can be a fixed amount or a percentage.

hours.description: Number of hours between start and end dates. Used for itineraries that require bookings that occur within hours and not days. E.g. Meeting room reservation.

guests.description: Total number of adults and children

Itinerary.description: Itinerary outlines stay dates, number of adults and children

gender.description: Identifier the gender of the customer.

birthDate.description: Indicates the date of birth as indicated in the document, in ISO 8601 prescribed format.

childQuantity.description: The number of children of the customer.

citizenship.description: Name of the (self-professed) country that is clamided for citizenship.

preferredCurrency.description: Type of funds preferred for reviewing monetary values, in ISO 4217 codes

language.description: The primary language of the customer

Personal.description: Detailed customer information for this profile

propertyLocationPref.description: Indicates preference for hotel property locations.

propertyTypePref.description: Indicates preference for hotel property types.

hotelChainPref.description: Identifies a preferred company by name.

propertyAmenityPref.description: Indicates preferences for hotel property amenities.

recreationSrvcPref.description: Indicates preference for the type of recreation services in a hotel

businessSrvcPref.description: Indicates preference for type of business services in a hotel

securityFeaturePref.description: Indicates preference of rtype of security features in a hotel

physChalFeaturePref.description: Indicates preferences for type of features required to meet the needs of persons with physical challenges, disabilities, etc.

items.description: Indicates preferences for type of features required to meet the needs of persons with physical challenges, disabilities, etc.

smokingAllowed.description: Indicates preference for smooking allowed rooms..

roomLocationPref.description: Indicates preference for hotel room locations.

foodSrvcPref.description: Indicates preferences for type of food listener facilities in a hotel.

roomAmenityPref.description: Indicates preferences for hotel room amenities.

share.description: Indicates whether the user wants to share this profile of themselves with hotel(s)

payable.description: When to charge for this item.

externalIdentifier.description: Optional geoname externalIdentifier to remote inventory.

refundable.description: Whether this booking is refundable or not.

advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved than just a no-questions-asked refundable.

refundableCancellationCharge.description: If advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge rules is not honored, this property explains what the guest will be charged.

noShowCharge.description: In case the 'Refundable cancellation charge' is set, a different no show charge can be applied.

nonRefundableCancellationCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is non-refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved to calculate what the guest will owe in case of a cancellation.

nonRefundableDeadline.description: The non-refundable charge might can have a deadline. If that deadline passes, the guest might be charged more.

nonRefundableAfterDeadlineCancellationCh.description: If the guest does not honor the non-refundable deadline rule, this charge dictates what she owes after the deadline passes.

requestedByIdentifier.description: The SSO person / entity that requested the refund.

description.description: A description of the refund that can be displayed to booker

requestType.description: The entity making the refund request

requestResponse.description: Admin may choose to respond to the refund request made by the hotel
requestResponse.example: We have rejected your request. Your cancellation policy does not warrant a manual refund.

receiptUrl.description: This is the receipt url that contains a friendly web confirmation page. Comes in on the webhook.

retries.description: In case a TripPay admin has to go in and re-send the refund request to Stripe, we want to not to the same calculations again when a retry is executed so we keep track of retries here.

allocation.description: The type of refund determines how the funds are deducted each beneficiary.

Refund.description: Refund objects allow you to refund a charge that has previously been created but not yet refunded. Funds will be refunded to the credit or debit card that was originally charged.

items.description: Where to redirect after successful OAuth2.

name.description: Name of this engine application. The first engine for every integrator will have the same name as its company name.

redirectUris.description: Where to redirect after web components successfully authenticate. For OAuth2 purposes.

items.description: Where to redirect after web components successfully authenticate. For OAuth2 purposes.

clientId.description: Client identifier used to authenticate an Oauth2 or web component request.

status.description: Account status shows if it's approved

AccountStatusResponse.description: Shows where the account is in terms of onboarding and readiness

TotalAggregateFunds.description: Aggregate funds for all booking contracts

accountIdentifier.description: Account identifier with these capture currencies

AvailableFunds.description: Object that holds before and after values of a particular amount after refund has been applied

count.description: Aggregate booking contract of the cancellation state

success.description: Whether the removal was successful or not.

message.description: Message with additional information; mostly if the removal request was a failure.

RemoveEntryResponse.description: Response object for when a system document is removed.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description:
## Retrieve access token
Make a POST (`Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded`) request to the Token URL below. Include one POST key/value entry: `grant_type=client_credentials` and include your clientID / secretKey credentials in a Basic Auth header. E.g. `Authorization: Basic base64_encode($clientId + ':' + $secretKey)`.
## Add Bearer access token to all API requests
Once you have the access token, you can pass that along on all API requests in the authentication header: `'Authorization: Bearer $accessToken`
oauth2ClientCredentials.name: Client Credentials
